Noah Segal-Gould
Student in Computer Science and Experimental Humanities

About

General-purpose programmer of desktop and web-applications with academic experience primarily specializing in the Digital Humanities. Originally from southern Connecticut, Noah spends his free time running Bard College's official Anime Club, making silly Twitter bots, and petting dogs.

Publications

The Life and Times of W.S. Teator
Bard College Experimental Humanities
January 2016
http://teatorfarm.bard.edu/

Participated in a competitive selection process to participate in a January 2016 project under the supervision of Bard College Experimental Humanities Digital Projects Coordinator Heidi Knoblauch. As a member of a group of 4 students, assisted in the development of a large-scale historic project focusing on the life of a historic apple farmer by the name of W.S. Teator.
